intro: Rhodosciadium longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed rhodosciadium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, branching stems and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. Its leaves are typically narrow and lance-shaped, with a hairy texture. Rhodosciadium longipes is often found in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils.
